silence._comment: If more than 20% of frames fall below the RMS silence threshold, the file is considered to contain excessive silence or dead air.

dynamic_range._comment: Dynamic range below 8 dB typically indicates heavy compression or overly flattened audio dynamics.

noise._comment: A 95th percentile zero-crossing rate above 0.25 suggests excessive high-frequency noise or distortion.

brightness._comment: A high spectral centroid (95th percentile above 6 kHz) may indicate overly harsh or brittle frequency content.

transients._comment: Low onset peak-to-mean ratios (<2.0) can indicate over-compression or loss of transient contrast.

policy._comment: Metrics within 10% of a threshold may be flagged as WARN instead of FAIL to indicate borderline quality issues.
